doc.str: Systems and methods for forward osmosis fluid purification using cloud point extraction

A process for purification of fluids, for example, desalination of seawater or brackish water, using organic solutes in a concentrated water solution for use in a forward osmosis process, to extract fresh water out of salt water through the forward osmosis membrane, and subsequently separating the organic solutes out of the diluted forward osmosis permeate by cloud point extraction, thereby regenerating a concentrated organic solution for recycling to the forward osmosis process, and fresh water for potable water use.

Petrotos, K. B. et al. "study of the direct osmotic concentration of tomato juice in tubular membrane--module configuration. I. The effect of certain basic process parameters on the process performance," Journal of Membrane Science 150 (1998) 99-110. cited by examiner . | Adham, S. et al. "Dewatering Reverse Osmosis Concentrate from Water Reuse Applications using Forward Osmosis," WateReuse Foundation, Alexandria, VA, 2007, p. 13. cited by examiner . | Cath, T.Y. et al., "Forward Osmosis: Principles, Applications, and Recent Developments," Journal of Membrane Science, 2006, pp. 70-87, vol. 281. cited by other. | McCutcheon et al. "A novel ammonia-carbon dioxide forward (direct) osmosis desalination process," Desalination 2005, 174, 1-11. cited by examiner . | International Search Report for PCT/US 09/68590, dated Feb. 19, 2010. cited by other . | Saeki, S. et al. "Upper and lower critical solution temperatures in poly(ethylene glycol) solutions," Polyer 1976, 17, 685-689. cited by examiner . | Joergensen, M. K. "Investigation of Polypropylene Glycol 425 as Possible Draw Solution for Forward Osmosis," Masters Thesis, Aalborg University, Denmark, Jun. 2009. cited by examiner . | Written Opinion of the International Searching Authority for PCT/ US09/68590, dated Feb. 19, 2010. cited by other .
